A technique used to assess the condition of written materials, which utilizes portable instruments and in-situ sampling to identify various components, quantify degradation, and provide information for conservation planning.

A non-invasive examination technique that employs portable instruments and soft materials to extract information about the composition, condition, and degradation of paper-based cultural heritage items without causing physical harm or alteration, providing conservators with vital data for informed preservation decisions.

A non-invasive scientific technique that uses portable instruments to analyze and identify the chemical composition of paper artifacts, including sizing, inks, and glues, as well as the degree of degradation, without causing damage to the object.
